text: The Battle of Isfahan strategic Khwarazmian victory and a tactical Mongol victory. https://www.historynet.com/mongol-empire-chormaquan-and-the-mongol- conquest-of-the-middle-east/?f HistoryNet. ==Background== Sultan Jalaluddin was thinking about the precautions he could take against the Mongols in his palace in Isfahan. He had defeated the Mongols in the Damghan area last year (1227).Mustafa Cankurt: Son Harzemşah Celaleddin https://www.kitapyurdu.com/kitap/son-harzemsah- celaleddin/630230.html?srsltid=AfmBOooKx- ixfT4SeZBrrQci3DgyVgc2zIoxq4GSRulsgaoqPsCNEP_GFfw ==Battle== In August 1228, a new Mongol army under the leadership of Taimas Noian invaded the re- established kingdom. Jalal al-Din met them near Isfahan and the two armies battled. The Mongols scored a Pyrrhic victory in this battle, unable to exploit their victory as they had no power left to advance. https://www.historynet.com/mongol-empire-chormaquan-and-the-mongol-conquest- of-the-middle-east/?f HistoryNet. ==Notes== Mustafa Cankurt: Son Harzemşah Celaleddin https://www.kitapyurdu.com/kitap/son-harzemsah- celaleddin/630230.html?srsltid=AfmBOooKx- ixfT4SeZBrrQci3DgyVgc2zIoxq4GSRulsgaoqPsCNEP_GFfw ==References== Category:13th-century conflicts Category:Wars involving Asia Category:Isfahan
